replies.author: ssalonen

replies.bodyText: The checked exceptions IllegalAccessException and InvocationTargetException are never thrown. So they could be removed. Specifying an unchecked exception like IllegalArgumentException has no effect in tests, AFAIK. So, that could be removed, too.
replies.author: fwolter

timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText:
Yes, that should be equivalent. Tests should further give confirmation on this.
Previously it was hard to get raw bytes "abstracted" by ModbusRegisterArray and this type of copying of bytes was needed.
A bit of modbus terminology: register means 16 bit (big endian) word returned by the modbus device. You could consider modbus being a remotely accessible memory, memory locations represented by register addresses.
Often in these bindings the register data is converted to 16/32 bit integers and floats, that we give meaning to that raw data.
